授業目的: To have students learn about Climate Justice – the inequitable impacts of climate change around the globe and to learn from different perspectives and initiatives mostly from Canada, and some U.S. and Japan. Students will be exposed to some practical tools and learn to reflect on their own contexts, articulate their concerns for climate justice, and propose an action.
到達目標: Students will learn about and explore together: the language development and history of climate justice; the key influencers and examples of leadership in Canada, the U.S., and Japan; the global trends and challenges; and tools for measurement, evaluation/reflection, and action for climate justice.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
関連科目: By topics of interest may include: Climate change science, social change, ecological economics, power and politics, climate refugees and migration, just transition
授業の概要・背景: Climate Justice helps us to examine the climate crisis through a human rights and equity lens. Climate Justice also challenges us to look for new and different ways to address these inequities and to challenge the political and economic structures and power holders for change to best facilitate a transition towards a just and sustainable society. Drawing from theory to practice, conceptual tools and analyses, students will be able to articulate what climate justice is, the need for climate justice now, with some ideas for action.
授業方法: This course will be taught with a mixture of lectures including recorded and live guest lecturers, group discussions, practical tool use and analyses, some contextual analyses, and sharing of ideas for action through presentations, a project proposal or findings, and/or paper readings. Class attendance and participation in discussions will be paramount.
